page.title: 01Loudoun Hill, Ayrshire
page.content: This area is situated 12 miles east of Kilmarnock astride the boundary between Kilmarnock and Loudoun district and East Kilbride district. The view is dominated by the 316 foot high volcanic rock known as Loudoun Hill, and a now disused railway viaduct which despite its listed building status is under threat of demolition. The A71 Kilmarnock to Edinburgh Road which disects the block has quarry sites on both sides, one quarry has obliterated the site of a roman fort while the other quarry has removed the site of one of the first battles in te wars of Scottish Independence.
